paper.title: From Reference Frames to Reference Planes: Multi-View Parallax Geometry and Applications
paper.abstract: This paper presents a new framework for analyzing the geometry of multiple 3D scene points from multiple uncalibrated images, based on decomposing the projection of these points on the images into two stages: (i) the projection of the scene points onto a (real or virtual) physical reference planar surface in the scene; this creates a virtual “image” on the reference plane, and (ii) the re-projection of the virtual image onto the actual image plane of the camera. The positions of the virtual image points are directly related to the 3D locations of the scene points and the camera centers relative to the reference plane alone. All dependency on the internal camera calibration parameters and the orientation of the camera are folded into homographies relating each image plane to the reference plane.
